page.title: 08Sharnbrook's Shoppers
page.content: There are 6{foodshops}in Sharnbrook which sell groceries, fresh fruit and vegetables, meat, and bread and confectionery. {Mobile shops}selling frozen foods, fresh fish, and fish and chips call at the village. People are happy to use the local shops for last minute items and fresh foods, but most people seem to do their main shopping weekly, or monthly, in the larger shops of{Bedford and Rushden,}where cheapness and convenient car parks make the supermarkets attractive. People are inclined to travel further when they are shopping for clothes - to{Milton Keynes, Cambridge or {Peterborough.} Rushden is popular for shoes as there are a number of shoe factory shops there. Few people buy goods from door to door salesmen, but half the people shop by post from mail order catalogues.
